title: Transfer news: Inter Milan ready to save Nemanja Matic from Man United in January
text:
Inter Milan are reportedly ready to save Nemanja Matic from Manchester United in January.

The midfielder has seen his game time restricted under manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer this campaign.

And now Matic could be on his way out of Old Trafford as Inter Milan boss Antonio Conte is looking to reunite with the former Chelsea midfielder, according to The Sun.

Inter Milan are reportedly ready to save Nemanja Matic from Manchester United in January

NEMANJA MATIC'S STATS AT MAN UNITED Appearances: 92 Goals: 3 Assists: 3

The pair worked together for one year at Stamford Bridge as the Blues lifted the Premier League title at the end of the 2016-17 season.

Matic made the switch from Chelsea to Manchester United for £40million in the summer of 2017.

He has made 92 appearances for the Red Devils, in which he has scored three goals and provided the same number of assists.

The midfielder has seen his game time restricted under manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer

Matic has only featured in five matches this season as Solskjaer has opted for youth in his side.

The 31-year-old's current contract at United runs out in the summer, although there is a clause in the deal which could extend it by one more year.

If Matic does not want to move during the winter transfer window, Conte is reportedly willing to wait until the summer to bring him in.
description: Matic and Conte worked together for one year at Stamford Bridge as the Blues lifted the Premier League title at the end of the 2016-17 season. The pair could be reunited as soon as January.
